definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: He earned only 3 silver dollar after pulling the rickshaw for a month.
sentences.chinese: 他辛辛苦苦拉一個月黃包車才賺3塊現大洋。

sentences.english: Boys who once pulled rickshaws now pedal pedicabs.
sentences.chinese: 曾經拉黃包車的男孩子們現在蹬三輪人力車了。

sentences.english: See Yu Zhixin shot in the ground, woomi jumped to his rickshaw.
sentences.chinese: 看到餘志鑫中槍倒地，友美跳下黃包車奔向他。

sentences.english: In her rickshaw on the street or in a cabaret.
sentences.chinese: 無論街上黃包車裏還是酒店裏。

sentences.english: A thirty-six volt battery can carry the rickshaw forty kilometers.
sentences.chinese: 三十六伏的電池能使該黃包車行駛四十千米。

sentences.english: And then, Hai enters a cyclo race, and wins.
sentences.chinese: 後來，海蔘加並贏得了一場三輪黃包車比賽。

sentences.english: This man is a rickshaw wallah and he works hard to raise his family.
sentences.chinese: 這個人是拉黃包車的，他努力幹活養活家人。

sentences.english: But I would want even less to pull a rickshaw.
sentences.chinese: 但是我更不想去拉黃包車。

definition: vehicle/(more specifically) mobility vehicle (mobility scooter, electric wheelchair, Segway etc)
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
Liehyu township in Kinmen County 金門縣|金门县[Jin1 men2 xian4] (Kinmen or Quemoy islands), Taiwan
